Manuscript.Keywords: Rip Up
Manuscript.Synopsis:
[ 2024 ] Titus and Sylvia reunited. First one he wakes to is her. Sylvia longs to be a part of something or else it feels like death.

[ 2023 ] Titus wakes in the Afterlife. Convinced to join the Royal Guard to avenge the ones Blackwater lost, and to repay debt of Essence transfer.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: Titus encounters Ullrich for a second time.

Manuscript.Label: Revise
Manuscript.Keywords: Rip Up
Manuscript.Synopsis:
[ 2024 ]  Ullrich convinces Titus to speak on behalf of the ones they "lost to the Chymaera in defending the Afterlife."

[ 2023 ]  To the land above {the Undercroft}. Ullrich's speech raises red flags adding to cognitive dissonance. Heiress of Purgatory / Mask introduced. Titus asked to speak as survivor.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: Tomorrow marks the advent of a golden age!

Manuscript.Label: Revise
Manuscript.Keywords: Rip Up
Manuscript.Synopsis:
[ 01/2024 ]  Titus speaks to courage. Insults show the true nature of why he is here: to be made fun of by the ones that wrought Endogeny. Only able to quip on them for a brief time before he is detained.

[ 2023 ] Speaks passionately. Insulted by Afterlife. Realizes nature of what was actually done. Insults their ignorance. Sylvia watches in horror, doing nothing, dissolving into the crowd. Assaulted. Titus restrained by Mask as they use the stolen fragment of Pure Essence to recall the Chymaeran God Endogeny.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis:
[ 01/2024 ]  Arrive at first floor of the Undercroft, kept with Lyra and Raine. Discussion leads to a brief backstory.

Heiress passes with the "champions" of the Undercroft that will serve as a fighting force to claim the territories to the south, to be joined by the upper-tier cadets later.
They are led after them to observe the final step of Endogeny's liquidation.

Manuscript.Synopsis: It's time for Titus to return.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: Titus recognizes the strength in his beloved friends.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: Titus enters his past self, twisting the speech in a different direction.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: Titus uses Isla's invitation to approach Valentina in her shed and ask for help. Titus asks her for help, expecting resistance. She agrees to travel with them.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: Titus digs deep and confronts one of his fears.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis:
Titus visits Sylvia in her room. She asks what he needs. He finally gives into catharsis. They kiss.
He asks her to come. She agrees. And then asks for something else: to be together.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis:
Sylvia and Titus show up to the house. Ellie is not there. Titus is afraid, but then Sylvia distracts him with a story from the past.
They spend more romantic time together.
"When the fuck did that happen?" Romin says.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: Titus and his plurality of friends explore the outer wastes of Blackwater.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis:
They arrive at the first safehouse by sundown, falling asleep after Romin lights the fireplace.
They think they heard something the night before. At the next safehouse, they find the shard of Pure Essence is missing.
Titus' friends give him the courage to continue, refusing to return. (For now?)

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis:
They make it to the Backwoods, threatened at gunpoint when discovered.
Titus prepares them for the sight of the house, sure that he will find the Amulet there. But the Amulet is missing, and this is inexplicable to Titus.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: Something's different this time. Can you feel it?

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: As they approach the Backwoods, the ghillie-cloaked Chymaeran First Red emerge from the snowbanks. Romin has his first exchange with his father. Titus meets Lyra for a third first-time. Romin shows character growth in scene with his father Raine, showing him the letter that his mother Rachel wrote. They agree to take the four travellers in out of curiosity.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis:
Titus tells Sylvia he knows about the other voice inside her. They approach the pebble of Pure Essence when the First Red is distracted by Romin.
The Daughter of Khiras emerges from Sylvia, withdrawing the threads from Titus in a wager of whether he has the fortitude to not go back.
The Daughter of Khiras offers the persuasion the First Red needed to return. Lyra sees Fletcher for her first time.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis:
The First Red begins their return to Blackwater. Titus and Sylvia sleep against each other. In the darkness of night, the First Red dissolve back into the city.
The First Red opens the vault. In the excitement, Maude surprises Titus when she approaches him, saying that Ellie has been taken.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: They ambush the ambush on future intelligence.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis:
Titus learns Maude is one of the Chymaeran informants in the First Red Carmine. In an act of letting go of the past, Titus gives his mother's necklace to Maude.
Titus and his father argue, but Titus concedes this time, somehow comforted in Ellie's disappearance.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis:
Romin, Lyra, and Titus stakeout the trade building. Romin is able to overcome his ego and trust Titus telling him to wait. The bust is a success, and they forestall the murders.

The First Red Chymaerans exchange markers, and now the First Red has moles in the Afterlife. They burn the building down for continuity.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: Titus returns home to find Sylvia there, and they sleep in the house. Valentina surprises them the next morning, asking them to dress-up and take a Carmine touring car to the Estate.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: The catgirl crashes back into her neglectul family's life.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: They smash the car through the front gates to make a scene. None of them are injured. The three would be kicked out if it weren't for Vanna's cries to see Valentina.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: Valentina provides proof, wagering her place in the Vermillion family. The evidence is indisputable.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: How in Khiras' name did they get together?

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis:
Vince and Raine have their first encounter in ages. They are invited inside, and the two factions socialize.
Sylvia and Titus are surprised to find the house's lights on, though Titus knows there is nothing left to steal. He finds his estranged mother, Emilia, sitting at the table.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: Emilia explains what happened to the other Emilia; Ullrich's guilt-ridden past; Titus' early beginnings after reawakening. Titus learns he is half-Chymaeran with royal blood on both sides. Emilia cursed Ullrich to die.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: Titus encounters someone from his past, but is still forced to say goodbye.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: Outside, Sylvia and Titus go on an existential talk regarding Sylvia's recent memories. Titus pins her against the wall and kisses her.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: Vince and Raine describe the plan at the Compound. Lyra, Valentina, and Titus will go undercover to the Afterlife in the Merlot's place. Titus says goodbye to Sylvia.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: The Carmine-Merlot master plan is set in motion.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis:
At the Merlotan Estate, Valentina looks at the place she died in another life. Valentina forgives Vera after learning what she did for her in the previous timeline.
At the top, they are ushered to the celebration where all the head Merlot families of the fifteen districts are coming together.
They enter the immaculate entrance hall and are seated at an unmarked table.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis:
Ullrich gives a speech to raise a toast. The wine they drink from is poisoned with Endogeny: the Merlot are the ones who start the epidemic.
Vera is poisoned. Titus can only save Vera or Valentina, and he transfers Essence to Val. Val pleads him to kill himself to save her sister.
Ullrich approaches. He forces Val and Titus to prove their "relationship" through a dispassionate kiss. He puts them up in his loft.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: What would happen if the Vermillions made it there?

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis:
Endogeny originates in the poisoned wine, starting with the very vehicle for the shitbloods' prolongued survival. Endogeny eviscerates all the unessenced ones. Valentina is unable to save her family from their terrible fate, and she weeps, and Titus laments his desire to return and prevent this. They are taken away by the Royal Guard before Endogeny can eviscerate them, led to confrontation with Ullrich, who only saves them due to his curious interest {in why the timeline changed.}
Ullrich directly asks why Valentina should be kept alive. She is useless. He says that Titus strove from nothing to reach the top, not gifted with royalty, and Titus says they are in love. They share a dispassionate kiss. Acting convinced, he says he will put them up in a room as guests of honor in his home, since at least Titus deserves it.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: One of the Vermillion girls tries driving.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: Make it to the front line of the Carmine/Merlot camp. They are becoming enclaved by the Royal Guard from the other provinces of the city: no choice but onwards. They are to rush on the gates. Romin gives a speech, rallying the troops, using Essenced explosives.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: The Lower City converges on the Afterlife.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis:
REF 1.6.4

Pressing through city streets. Desperate "civilians" approach, pleading for protection. Valentina reaches out to help, but is attacked and stabbed by guised Royal Guard. As the guised Royal Guard open fire, Valentina slows time, allowing them to escape. The Royal Guard are taken out by Raine, Lyra, Clint, Emilia, and others in the CM alliance, urging them along, saying they only have one shot at preventing the Vassal. Vera stays back, tending to her sister.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: Titus takes ownership for a world he was only reborn into.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: Titus awakes in area below the city with Lyra, confronted with Endogeny. False copies of Romin, Valentina, Clint, and Emilia all beg him to go back and save them, to let them live complete lives (mirror water dream), but he continues. In the great atrium, Sylvia is bound, to be kept alive or else Khiras will break through in the Essence transfer. Same scene as the first end. Ullrich says Titus knows so little of what actually makes them special: divine blood crossed between Chymaeran and Human pure lines.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: Dialogue between Ulrich and Titus on going back as they fight in a time-traveler's brawl, while Lyra resists Ellie. Lyra is incapacitated at the edge of death. With no other options, Titus makes the sacrifice of severing his final thread, releasing Sylvia from the world. He gains the power of the Mask of the Humans, finally able to overpower Ullrich. The ground shakes. Volcanic lava rises in the pit.  Khiras is coming. He extinguishes Ullrich's Essence, casting him into a pit. In a sudden turn of luck after endless assumed deaths, Ullrich's weapon catches, suspending him on the side of the pit somewhere below, and he is nearly brain-dead from the endless cycles.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis: There is no salvation from failure this time. Titus and his adversary fight through the fabric of time itself.

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis:
"Now either Ellie must kill Titus or Titus must kill Ellie, deciding the fate of Blackwater and the crossed Chosen.
Ellie's last moments with Titus are now revealed, the mission she has for him to complete: to kill her and end all of this, saying she will be unpersuadable. But Titus attempts to talk her down from Endogeny. He explains the nature of all he has given up to come here, that by severing the thread, this worldline will be forever. He disarms her and embraces her. Ellie says she is ""so tired,"" tears in her eyes, and Titus says he will love her forever. Knowing Titus doesn't have the strength inside to do it, and wishing to take the burden from him in doing this, she unsheathes the dagger behind Titus' toolbelt and kills herself, falling headlong into the pit.  "

Manuscript.Label: No Label
Manuscript.Synopsis:
Not a good ending here: fix it. Titus should be given the freedom to die and be reborn, but due to his suffering in bringing the endless loop to a conclusion, Khiras gives him the chance to live this life. And Sylvia persuades him to stay. He decides to continue on, living with the consequences of his actions unable to unwrite them, a central theme of the story.

Possibility for Ullrich to survive after infinity in the same living/dying fall cycle.
